## escalate() function

Escalates an error by sending it as an event to this machine's parent.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function escalate<TContext extends MachineContext, TExpressionEvent extends EventObject, TExpressionAction extends ParameterizedObject | undefined, TErrorData = any, TEvent extends EventObject = AnyEventObject>(errorData: TErrorData | ((args: UnifiedArg<TContext, TExpressionEvent, TEvent>) => TErrorData), options?: SendToActionParams<TContext, TExpressionEvent, TExpressionAction, EventObject, TEvent, string>): SendToAction<TContext, TExpressionEvent, TExpressionAction, TEvent, string>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  errorData | TErrorData \| ((args: [UnifiedArg](./xstate.unifiedarg.md)<></>&lt;TContext, TExpressionEvent, TEvent&gt;) =&gt; TErrorData) | The error data to send, or the expression function that takes in the <code>context</code>, <code>event</code>, and <code>meta</code>, and returns the error data to send. |
|  options | [SendToActionParams](./xstate.sendtoactionparams.md)<></>&lt;TContext, TExpressionEvent, TExpressionAction, [EventObject](./xstate.eventobject.md)<></>, TEvent, string&gt; | _(Optional)_ Options to pass into the send action creator. |

**Returns:**

[SendToAction](./xstate.sendtoaction.md)<></>&lt;TContext, TExpressionEvent, TExpressionAction, TEvent, string&gt;
